main event: A report of an unconventional aircraft sighting over Spokane, Washington on May 29, 1951.
interesting points: The object was described as elliptical and flat, similar to a silver disc or thin aircraft wing., It exhibited no noise or visible exhaust., The object moved rapidly from the northeast to the southwest before ascending out of sight., The sighting lasted approximately 4 minutes with the object disappearing and reappearing multiple times., The sighting involved credible witnesses, including 2 officers and 2 airmen.
sighted object: An elliptical and flat object, light silver in color, moving rapidly.
witness description: 2 officers (pilots) and 2 airmen reported seeing the object.
